TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Allocation extends Android.Renderscripts.BaseObj

remarks.para: This class provides the primary method through which data is passed to and from RenderScript kernels. An Allocation provides the backing store for a given .

An Allocation also contains a set of usage flags that denote how the Allocation could be used. For example, an Allocation may have usage flags specifying that it can be used from a script as well as input to a . A developer must synchronize across these different usages using in order to ensure that different users of the Allocation have a consistent view of memory. For example, in the case where an Allocation is used as the output of one kernel and as Sampler input in a later kernel, a developer must call prior to launching the second kernel to ensure correctness.
Developer Guides
An Allocation can be populated with the routines. For more complex Element types, the methods can be used to copy from byte arrays or similar constructs.
For more information about creating an application that uses RenderScript, read the RenderScript developer guide.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void CopyFrom (Android.Graphics.Bitmap b);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyFrom(class Android.Graphics.Bitmap b) cil managed

Docs.param: the source bitmap
Docs.summary: Copy into this Allocation from an array.

remarks.para: Copy into an Allocation from a . The height, width, and format of the bitmap must match the existing allocation.
If the is the same as the used to create the Allocation with and is set on the Allocation, this will synchronize the Allocation with the latest data from the , potentially avoiding the actual copy.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Renderscripts.Allocation CreateCubemapFromBitmap (Android.Renderscripts.RenderScript rs, Android.Graphics.Bitmap b);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Renderscripts.Allocation CreateCubemapFromBitmap(class Android.Renderscripts.RenderScript rs, class Android.Graphics.Bitmap b) cil managed

Docs.param: Context to which the allocation will belong.
bitmap with cubemap faces layed out in the following format: right, left, top, bottom, front, back
Docs.summary: Creates a non-mipmapped cubemap Allocation for use as a graphics texture from a containing the horizontal list of cube faces.

remarks.para: Creates a non-mipmapped cubemap Allocation for use as a graphics texture from a containing the horizontal list of cube faces. Each face must be a square, have the same size as all other faces, and have a width that is a power of 2.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void GenerateMipmaps ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GenerateMipmaps() cil managed

Docs.summary: Generate a mipmap chain.

remarks.para: Generate a mipmap chain. This is only valid if the Type of the Allocation includes mipmaps.
This function will generate a complete set of mipmaps from the top level LOD and place them into the script memory space.
If the Allocation is also using other memory spaces, a call to is required.

remarks.para: Send a buffer to the output stream. The contents of the Allocation will be undefined after this operation. This operation is only valid if is set on the Allocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Resize (int dimX);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Resize(int32 dimX) cil managed

Docs.param: The new size of the allocation.
Docs.summary: Resize a 1D allocation.

remarks.para: Resize a 1D allocation. The contents of the allocation are preserved. If new elements are allocated objects are created with null contents and the new region is otherwise undefined.
If the new region is smaller the references of any objects outside the new region will be released.
A new type will be created with the new dimension.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
